skill.name: agent-management
skill.description: Design, create, and maintain Claude Code subagents with optimal tool permissions, model tiers, and configurations. Triggered when users request to create or update subagents.
skill.summary: Design and create optimal Claude Code subagents with appropriate tools and configurations
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All 98 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This skill consists solely of markdown documentation files (SKILL.md, template.md, references/subagent-doc.md) that provide workflow instructions for creating Claude Code subagents. The static scanner detected patterns in documentation text (code examples, file paths, command syntax) but found no actual executable code, shell commands, or malicious patterns. This is a legitimate documentation skill with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Claude Code subagents enable task-specific AI configurations for improved context management and specialized workflows. This skill provides a structured approach to designing and implementing optimal subagent configurations with appropriate tools, model tiers, and constraints.
actual_capabilities: Design Claude Code subagents with appropriate tool permissions and model tiers
Create new subagent configurations using structured YAML frontmatter and templates
Update existing subagents with new capabilities and refined configurations
Validate subagent configurations for conflicts and proper structure
Organize subagents into team folders with consistent naming conventions
Generate detailed acceptance criteria and workflow phases for each subagent
limitations: Does not execute code or perform actual development tasks directly
Cannot modify files outside the .claude/agents directory structure
Does not integrate with external services or APIs
Limited to configuration generation without runtime execution

use_cases.title: Create a Code Review Subagent
use_cases.description: Design and configure a specialized code review subagent with Read, Grep, Glob, and Bash tools. Perfect for teams wanting consistent code quality checks across projects.

use_cases.title: Build a Debugger Subagent
use_cases.description: Create a debugging specialist subagent with root cause analysis capabilities. Ideal for troubleshooting complex issues and implementing fixes systematically.

use_cases.title: Set Up a Data Analysis Subagent
use_cases.description: Configure a data science subagent for SQL queries and BigQuery operations. Enables efficient data exploration with predefined workflows and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Create a New Subagent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [agent-type] subagent named [agent-name] that handles [primary-tasks]. Use the sonnet model and grant access to [tools] tools only.
prompt_templates.scenario: Basic subagent creation with minimal requirements

prompt_templates.title: Update Existing Subagent
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the [existing-agent] subagent to add [new-capability]. Review the current configuration first and ensure no role conflicts exist.
prompt_templates.scenario: Enhancing an existing subagent with new functionality

prompt_templates.title: Create Complex Multi-Phase Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a [role] subagent with 3 core responsibilities. Include workflow phases for [phase1], [phase2], and [phase3]. Use opus model for complex reasoning tasks.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a sophisticated subagent with detailed workflow structure

prompt_templates.title: Generate Team-Based Agent Suite
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a suite of 3 related subagents for the [team-name] team: [agent-1], [agent-2], [agent-3]. Ensure consistent naming conventions and non-overlapping responsibilities.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building a coordinated set of specialized agents for a team

output_examples.input: Create a test-runner subagent that runs tests and fixes failures
output_examples.output: A new subagent file at .claude/agents/test-runner.md with YAML frontmatter including name, description, tools (Bash, Read, Edit), and model (sonnet). The system prompt defines responsibilities for test execution, failure analysis, and fix implementation.
A subagent configuration with Read, Grep, Edit tools focused on documentation creation and updates. Includes workflow phases for content research, drafting, and review.

output_examples.input: Update the code-reviewer to use haiku model
output_examples.output: Modified subagent configuration with model field updated to haiku, preserving all existing tools, responsibilities, and workflow structure.

best_practices: Start with Claude-generated agents as a foundation, then customize to fit specific needs rather than writing from scratch
Limit tool access to only what the subagent requires for its purpose to improve security and focus
Design subagents with single, clear responsibilities rather than trying to make one agent handle everything
anti_patterns: Creating subagents with overlapping responsibilities that compete for the same tasks
Granting excessive tool permissions that are not relevant to the subagent's core purpose
Omitting detailed system prompts that provide specific guidance on how the subagent should operate

faq.question: What model should I choose for my subagent?
faq.answer: Use haiku for simple, focused tasks. Use sonnet for balanced capability and cost. Use opus for complex reasoning requiring highest intelligence. Default to sonnet unless you have specific needs.

faq.question: Where are subagents stored and how do they take precedence?
faq.answer: Project subagents go in .claude/agents/ and user subagents go in ~/.claude/agents/. When names conflict, project-level subagents take precedence.

faq.question: Can I restrict what tools a subagent can use?
faq.answer: Yes. Specify tools as a comma-separated list in the YAML frontmatter. Omit the tools field entirely to grant access to all tools from the main conversation.

faq.question: How do I invoke a subagent explicitly?
faq.answer: Mention the subagent in your request: 'Use the code-reviewer subagent to check my changes.' Claude Code also automatically delegates based on task descriptions.

faq.question: What makes a good subagent description?
faq.answer: Include phrases like 'use PROACTIVELY' or 'MUST BE USED' to encourage Claude to delegate appropriately. Be specific about when the subagent should be invoked.

faq.question: Can subagents access MCP tools?
faq.answer: Yes. When the tools field is omitted, subagents inherit all tools including MCP tools from the main thread. When tools are specified, only those are available.
